intro: Vangueria sapinii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant features showy yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-shaped structure, and its leaves are alternate and often lobed. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other similar species. Vangueria sapinii is adapted to arid environments and is often used in traditional medicine.
